climbs.name: Tame Your Duality
climbs.fa: Brent Bingham, Scott Duemler, Manny Rangel

content.description: Steeper and much funner than it initially looks. Protects with gear but climbs like a sport route. Intermittent gear up thin crack system through small pinching roof then finger crack splitting face than pinches down as you get higher. Past ledge then another short wall to top.
content.protection: A few of your smallest cams and up to #1 plus nuts.
content.location: Left of Machete about 100 feet, just left obvious left facing corner, starts below small pinching roof.

content.description: In the center of Sycamore wall there is a steep/overhung section. On the left side of that you will see a bolt about 15 feet up - this is the beginning of the route. Start below, slightly right of bolt then above bolt work left on horizontal slightly the straight up to reachy move then onto dirty ledge committing but good pro 5.10a. On ledge look for bolt slightly left, clip then continue essentially straight up from there for about 100 more feet on easier climbing 5.7 to top - aim for the tallest part of the wall. Pro when you need it, good rock. A single bolt marks the top of the route.
content.protection: triples from micro cams to 0.75, double #1BD, single #2, nuts and 6 extendable runners and 6 draws to minimize rope drag. Descent by walking left slightly at top and look for 2 bolt anchor on boulder on top of route "Machete" for singe rap with a 70m.

climbs.name: Machete
climbs.fa: Scott Duemler, Manny Rangel, Brent Bingham

content.description: Middle of left side of wall, start below large ledge, up easy crack to cruxy bulge the wander more or less straight up to boulder atop wall. Great rock, mostly easy 5.6
content.protection: cams 00 (metolious for first move off big ledge) to #3 BD, doubles through #1, single #2 and #3, nuts and lots of extenders.

climbs.name: Hershey
climbs.fa: Manny Rangel, Brent Bingham, Paul Paonessa, Joe Garcia

content.description:
First pitch has two cruxes, both steep moves with good protection. First when topping the blocky start and second while passing bulge with finger crack. 

  Second pitch crux is passing a slight bulge too. Pro is just below it.
content.protection: nuts, cams, trad draws (thin fingers to #3 cam)
content.location: From center of wall, go right until easy to mount ledge. Walk to right end of ledge to blocky arete start. Pitch one goes up blocks to finger crack and tops on ledge with two bolt anchor. Second pitch continues directly up and go a bit left after the bulge to top and second anchor. Rap route with 60m rope.

climbs.name: Chossum
climbs.fa: Scott Duemler, Aaron Collins, Christine Duemler

content.description: Good rock but blocky and dirty in spots. Pro when you need it
content.protection: Singles tips to #3 BD, nuts full set, extended slings and a few draws helpful. 1 bolt plus a 1 bolt anchor partway up if you want to do as 2 pitches.
content.location: On far right side of wall, start below broken dihedral that ends in buldge. Ascend dihedral past bolt about 25 ft up then continue corner with ledges. Go right at bee hive thru easy chimney to large ledge. Look for bolt at base of headwall and either end pitch or continue up steeper blocky section to left side of rocky prominence to top. Walk left at top to find rap anchor for machete.

content.description: Great Granite 150-200 foot wall. Steep approach but beautiful canyon and worth the effort.
